verbs.description: reprogram (third-person singular simple present reprograms, present participle reprogramming or reprograming, simple past and past participle reprogrammed or reprogramed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing) To program anew or differently.
(transitive, by extension) To make a fundamental change to the behaviour or habits of.
(government) To shift funds appropriated for one government program to a different government program.
examples: This deferral is reported to give Congress time to consider a request to reprogram the funds.
